definition: to vow
hair/Taiwan pr. [fa3]
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
honest/prudent/variant of 願|愿[yuan4]
to hope/to wish/to desire/hoped-for/ready/willing

sentences.english: Vow to be the earth that nurtures plants and cradles sentient beings.
sentences.chinese: 发愿作一方大地，普载众生，生长万物。

sentences.english: If there are beings who hear this teaching, they should aspire to be born in that land.
sentences.chinese: 若有众生，闻是说者，应当发愿，生彼国土。

sentences.english: Vow to be a flower bearing fragrance.
sentences.chinese: 发愿作一朵鲜花，吐露芬芳，给人清香。

sentences.english: Vow to be the winter sun shedding warmth.
sentences.chinese: 发愿作一个冬阳，温暖大地，成熟万物。

sentences.english: Like Tara, she took a vow to always be reborn as a woman.
sentences.chinese: 像度母一样，她发愿常转世为女身利益众生。

sentences.english: Make great vows, to benefit all sentient beings.
sentences.chinese: 发愿必须发利益众生的大愿。

sentences.english: Vow to be a streetlight showing the way.
sentences.chinese: 发愿作一盏路灯，照破黑暗，指引光明。

sentences.english: The buddhas and bodhisattvas have vowed to work towards the accomplishment of selfless aspiration prayers such as these.
sentences.chinese: 诸佛菩萨曾发愿要让如本文的无私愿力祈请文能圆成。

sentences.english: Vow to be an artist's brush adding to the world's beauty.
sentences.chinese: 发愿作一支画笔，采绘世界，增添美丽。
